title: Learn Climate with Open MIT Resources

media:group.media:title: Learn Climate with Open MIT Resources
media:group.media:description:
Whether you are new to climate change, an experienced advocate, or a professional weaving climate into your work, MIT has free high-quality materials to deepen and expand your understanding about the climate, energy, and solutions. With a range of engaging introductions to complete in-depth open courses from MIT’s Environmental Solutions Initiative, OpenCourseWare and MITx, MIT supports students, teachers, professionals and lifelong learners with engaging and essential climate change knowledge.

This webinar was held on October 25, 2022, as part of International Open Access Week 2022 around the theme “Open for Climate Justice.”

Speakers:

Sylvia Scharf: Climate Education Specialist, MIT Environmental Solutions Initiative
Curt Newton: Director, MIT OpenCourseWare
Dana Doyle: Director, MITx Program

MIT resources discussed:

MIT Climate Portal: https://climate.mit.edu/
MIT Climate Primer: https://climateprimer.mit.edu/
TILclimate Guides for Educators: https://climate.mit.edu/educators
SCALES Project: https://scales.mit.edu/
MIT OpenCourseWare: https://ocw.mit.edu
MITx Online: https://mitxonline.mit.edu
MITx on edX: https://www.edx.org/school/mitx
MIT Open Learning Library: https://openlearninglibrary.mit.edu/

License: Creative Commons BY-NC-SA 
More information at https://ocw.mit.edu/terms 
More courses at https://ocw.mit.edu 
Support OCW at http://ow.ly/a1If50zVRlQ
